intro: Echinodorus bolivianus, commonly known as the Bolivian arrowhead, is a tropical aquatic plant native to South America. It is characterized by its broad, arrow-shaped leaves that float on the water surface or emerge from the water. The plant has a robust rhizome system that allows it to spread and establish itself in aquatic environments. It prefers shallow, still or slow-moving waters with moderate to high light levels. Echinodorus bolivianus is often used in aquariums and water gardens for its ornamental value and ability to improve water quality.
